body: Did you change Windows Terminal position or size?
I didn't change the outer frame but this pane's size changed when I opened another split pane below it.

OK I can repro this.  Open a PowerShell 7 tab in WT.  Execute this:
```
1..100 | %{Write-Progress -Activity 'Progress in PSIC' -PercentComplete $_; Sleep -m 500}
```
Then open up a horizontal split-pane and then just wait for the progress bar to finish and remove itself.  That's when it crashes:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5177512/80444336-bafced80-88ce-11ea-872a-5d620f4671a1.png)

This will happen on all console hosts where the buffer size is equal to the screen size and the buffer/screen size change during the progress operation. This is not a reasonable state in which to fail. :smile:
When writing back the output cells, PowerShell needs to _not instantly beef it_ when it fails to do so. The data that's lost isn't worth destroying the user's session over.

I think I hit the same error on PowerShell 7.1.3 in Windows Terminal, when I resized the window (moved it to a different monitor) during an operation that was displaying progress.  The process however did not terminate, and the operation continued after the error. There are currently no try…catch statements in the script; if there had been one, I fear that it might have unnecessarily escalated the error.

     | 140,49. (Parameter 'value.Y') Actual value was 51.

Funky prefix characters are the result of piping the command to `clip` and pasting here. An encoding issue that only happens with certain commands, but can be ignored.

Saving the text behind the progress bar and restoring it later is not compatible with supplementary characters either, as [ReadConsoleOutput](https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/console/readconsoleoutput) cannot fit them in [CHAR_INFO](https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/console/char-info-str).

```PowerShell
Clear-Host; "`n`n`u{1F600}`n`n`n`n`n"; Start-Sleep -Seconds 1; Write-Progress -Activity "Make some progress" -PercentComplete 50; Start-Sleep -Seconds 1; Write-Progress -Activity "Make some progress" -Completed
```

If minimal progress rendering <https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/14426> eventually becomes the default, then it will fix these problems for good, I hope.
This happened to me too just now. Splitting a pane while downloading a large file to keep working. Powershell instead gave up on the download.
I've hit something similar on OSX, with a much smaller repro in #16174. Maybe a SIGWINCH is getting dropped somewhere, if WinTerminal is generating one?
